definitions.definition: An allotrope of carbon , consisting of planes of carbon atoms arranged in hexagonal arrays with the planes stacked loosely, that is used as a dry lubricant , in "lead" pencils , and as a moderator in some nuclear reactors .
Graphite- reinforced plastic , a composite plastic made with graphite fibers noted for lightweight strength and stiffness.
examples: Modern tennis racquets are made of graphite , fibreglass and other man-made materials.

definitions.definition: A grey colour, resembling graphite or the marks made with a graphite pencil.

main_definition: An allotrope of carbon , consisting of planes of carbon atoms arranged in hexagonal arrays with the planes stacked loosely, that is used as a dry lubricant , in "lead" pencils , and as a moderator in some nuclear reactors .
secondary_definitions: Graphite- reinforced plastic , a composite plastic made with graphite fibers noted for lightweight strength and stiffness.
A grey colour, resembling graphite or the marks made with a graphite pencil.
